1901.event: Edward VII becomes King of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions and Emperor of India upon the death of Queen Victoria.
Platt Amendment limits the autonomy of Cuba in exchange for withdrawal of American troops.
Emily Hobhouse reports on the terrible conditions in the 45 British concentration camps for Boer women and children in South Africa.
Assassination of William McKinley. Vice President Theodore Roosevelt assumes office as President of the United States following McKinley's death on September 14.
Guglielmo Marconi receives the first trans-Atlantic radio signal.

1902.event: Cuba gains independence from the United States.
Arthur Balfour becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Willis Carrier invents the first modern electrical air conditioning unit.
Venezuela Crisis, in which Britain, Germany and Italy sustain a naval blockade on Venezuela in order to enforce collection of outstanding financial claims.

1903.event: The first teddy bear is invented.
The first Tour de France is held.
In Russia the Bolsheviks and the Mensheviks form from the breakup of the Russian Social Democratic Labor Party.
Independence of Panama, the Hay–Bunau-Varilla Treaty is signed by the United States and Panama.
First controlled heavier-than-air flight of the Wright Brothers.
The Ottoman Empire and the German Empire sign an agreement to build the Constantinople-Baghdad Railway.

1904.event: A Japanese surprise attack on Port Arthur (Lushun) starts the Russo-Japanese War.
Entente cordiale signed between Britain and France.
Construction of the Panama Canal begins.
End of British expedition to Tibet.
Herero and Namaqua Genocide, the first genocide of the 20th century, begins in German South-West Africa.
Roger Casement publishes his account of Belgian atrocities in the Congo Free State.

1905.event: The Revolution of 1905 in Russia begins.
The First Moroccan Crisis begins, going until May 1906.
The Norwegian Parliament declares the union with Sweden dissolved, and Norway achieves full independence.
Albert Einstein's formulation of special relativity.
The British Indian Province of Bengal, partitioned by the Viceroy of India, Lord Curzon.
Henry Campbell-Bannerman becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

1906.event: An earthquake in San Francisco, California, magnitude 7.9, kills 3,000.
Alfred Dreyfus is exonerated and reinstated as a major in the French Army; the Dreyfus Affair ends.
An earthquake in Valparaíso, Chile, magnitude 8.2, kills 20,000.
The US begins the Second Occupation of Cuba.
Brazilian inventor Alberto Santos-Dumont takes off and flies his 14-bis to a crowd in Paris.
The Muslim League is formed by Nawab Salimullah Khan of Dacca.
The Stolypin reform in Russia creates a new class of affluent kulaks.

1907.event: A peasants' revolt in Romania kills roughly 11,000.
Elections to the new Parliament of Finland are the first in the world with woman candidates, as well as the first elections in Europe where universal suffrage is applied.
The Indian National Congress splits into two factions at its Surat session, presided by Rash Behari Bose.
Persian Constitutional Revolution ends with the establishment of a parliament.
The Anglo-Russian Entente bring a pause in The Great Game in Central Asia.
Bakelite, the world's first fully synthetic plastic, invented in New York by Leo Baekeland, who coins the term "plastics".

1908.event: The coldest year since 1880 according to NASA.
Start of publication of Robert Baden-Powell's Scouting for Boys in London.
H. H. Asquith becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
First commercial Middle-Eastern oilfield established, at Masjed Soleyman in southwest Persia.
The Tunguska impact devastates thousands of square kilometres of Siberia.
Young Turk Revolution in the Ottoman Empire.
The Ford Motor Company invents the Model T.
Austria-Hungary annexes Bosnia-Herzegovina, triggering the Bosnian Crisis.
Pu Yi, the last Emperor of China, assumes the throne.
The 1908 Messina earthquake in southern Italy, magnitude 7.1, kills 70,000 people.

1909.event: William Howard Taft is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909 signed (effective on 9 July).
Bosnian crisis ends with Austria-Hungary's annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Robert E. Peary claims to have reached the North Pole though the claim is subsequently heavily contested.
A countercoup fails in the Ottoman Empire.
A revolution forces Mohammad Ali Shah, Persian Shah of the Qajar dynasty to abdicate in favor of his son Ahmad Shah Qajar.
Japan and China sign the Jiandao/Gando Treaty.

1910.event: Boy Scouts of America is founded.
George V becomes King of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions and Emperor of India.
Montenegro is proclaimed an independent kingdom.
The 5 October 1910 revolution in Portugal and proclamation of the First Portuguese Republic.
Beginning of the Mexican Revolution (Plan of San Luis Potosí).

1911.event: Roald Amundsen first reaches the South Pole.
Eugene B. Ely lands on the deck of the USS Pennsylvania stationed in San Francisco harbor, marking the first time an aircraft lands on a ship.
Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire in New York City results in the deaths of 146 workers and leads to sweeping workplace safety reforms.
The Italo-Turkish war which led to the capture of Libya by Italy, begins.
Xinhai Revolution, which overthrew the Qing dynasty of China, begins.
Swiss race car driver and automotive engineer Louis Chevrolet co-founds the Chevrolet Motor Company in Detroit with his brother Arthur Chevrolet, William C. Durant and others.
New Delhi becomes the capital of British India.
Ernest Rutherford identifies the atomic nucleus.

1912.event: The African National Congress is founded.
End of the Chinese Empire. Republic of China established.
Arizona becomes the last state to be admitted to the continental Union.
Morocco becomes a protectorate of France.
Emperor Meiji dies, ending the Meiji Era; his son, the Emperor Taishō, becomes Emperor of Japan.
The Kuomintang, the Chinese nationalist party, is founded.
United States occupation of Nicaragua begins.

1913.event: In the 1913 Ottoman coup d'état, Ismail Enver comes to power.
La Decena Trágica in Mexico City.
Woodrow Wilson is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Igor Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring infamously premiers in Paris.
Ford Motor Company introduces the first moving assembly line.
The Federal Reserve System is created.
Yuan Shikai uses military force to dissolve China's parliament and rules as a dictator.
Niels Bohr formulates the first cohesive model of the atomic nucleus, and in the process paves the way to quantum mechanics.

1914.event: Gavrilo Princip assassinates Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in Sarajevo, triggering the start of World War I.
Martha, last known passenger pigeon, dies.
The Race to the Sea leaves Germany and the Allies entrenched along the Western Front.
The United Kingdom establishes the Sultanate of Egypt as a protectorate.
Edgar Rice Burroughs publishes Tarzan of the Apes.

1915.event: Second Battle of Ypres begins, first widespread use of poison gas.
The deportation of Armenian leaders and notables in Constantinople signals the onset of the Armenian Genocide.
In the Banana Wars, the United States occupation of Haiti begins.

The first large scale use of poison gas by both sides in World War I occurs, first by the Germans at the Battle of Bolimów on the eastern front, and at the Second Battle of Ypres on the western front, and then by the British at the Battle of Loos.

1916.event: The Gallipoli Campaign ends in failure.
The first nationwide implementation of daylight saving time in the German Empire and Austria-Hungary.
The Warlord Era begins in China after the death of Yuan Shikai.
First use of tanks at the Battle of Flers-Courcelette.
The Pact is agreed upon by both the Congress and the Muslim League at the Indian city of Lucknow.
David Lloyd George becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Grigori Rasputin is assassinated by H.H. Prince Felix Youssoupov.
Market Square, one of the earliest shopping malls, opens in the Chicago metropolitan area.

1917.event: Russian Revolution ends the Russian Empire; beginning of Russian Civil War.
USA joins the Allies for the last 17 months of World War I.
Apparitions of Our Lady of the Rosary in Fatima, Portugal.
The Third Battle of Gaza ends in British victory.
The National Hockey League is formed in Montreal, Canada.

1918.event: Beginning of the Spanish flu pandemic, which lasts until April 1920 and kills tens of millions.
Mehmed VI becomes the last Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and the last Caliph.
Assassination of Tsar Nicholas II and his family.
The Hundred Days Offensive sends Germany into defeat.
the State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs is established.
The Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen founded.
The Partitioning of the Ottoman Empire begins.
Independence declared in the West Ukrainian People's Republic.
The Armistice of 11 November 1918 ends World War I.
The Kingdom of Iceland, a personal union with Denmark, is formed.

1919.event: The International Labour Organization is established.

The Jallianwala Bagh massacre in northern India: Acting Brigadier-General Reginald Dyer orders troops of the British Indian Army to fire their rifles into a crowd of unarmed Indian civilians, killing from 379 to 1,000 people and injuring another 1,500.
The Treaty of Versailles redraws European borders.
German Revolution ends with the collapse of the German Empire and the establishment of the Weimar Republic.
Release date of Feline Follies, the first appearance of Felix the Cat (then known as Master Tom).
First experimental evidence for the General theory of relativity obtained by Arthur Eddington.

1920.event: Prohibition in the United States begins.
Victory for Estonia in the Estonian War of Independence.
Red Army invasion of Azerbaijan and Armenia ends the Armenian–Azerbaijani War and concludes with their incorporation into the Soviet Union.
Greece restores its monarchy after a referendum.

1921.event: Premiere of the science-fiction play R.U.R. (Rossum's Universal Robots), in which the word "robot" was first used.
Russia invades Georgia and incorporates it into the Soviet Union.
Warren G. Harding is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Adolf Hitler becomes Führer of the Nazi Party as hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic begins.
The Italian National Fascist Party is established by Benito Mussolini.
Coup brings the Pahlavi dynasty to power in Iran.

1922.event: The Washington Naval Treaty is signed.
Mohandas Gandhi calls off Non-cooperation movement.
Egypt gains independence from the United Kingdom, though British forces still occupy the Suez Canal.
Andrew Bonar Law becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
March on Rome brings Benito Mussolini to power in Italy.
Ottoman Sultanate abolished by the Turkish Grand National Assembly; Sultan Mehmed VI is deposed.
Irish Free State is established, while the Province of Northern Ireland is created within The United Kingdom.
Gabriel Narutowicz, President of Poland, is assassinated.
The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR), the world's first officially Communist state, is formed.
The union of Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador is dissolved.
The Italian reconquest of Libya begins.

1923.event: Stanley Baldwin becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
A military coup ousts and kills Bulgarian Prime Minister Aleksandar Stamboliyski.
Death of Warren G. Harding; Vice President Calvin Coolidge assumes office as President of the United States.
The Great Kantō earthquake kills at least 105,000 people in Japan.
Turkish War of Independence ends; Ankara replaces Istanbul as its capital.
Kemal Atatürk becomes the first President of the newly established Republic of Turkey.
The Walt Disney Company is founded.
The Beer Hall Putsch, an attempt to overthrow the Weimar Republic, ends in failure and brief imprisonment for Adolf Hitler but brings the Nazi Party to national attention.
Hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic ends with the introduction of the Rentenmark.

1924.event: The death of Vladimir Lenin triggers power struggle between Leon Trotsky and Joseph Stalin.
Ramsay MacDonald becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
The first edition of the Winter Olympic Games is hosted in Chamonix, France.
Rhapsody in Blue by George Gershwin premieres in New York City.
The Caliphate is abolished by Kemal Atatürk.
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation founded under J. Edgar Hoover.
U.S. Immigration Act of 1924 significantly restricts immigration from Asia, the Middle East, and Southern Europe.
The August Uprising in Georgia against Soviet rule.
Stanley Baldwin becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

1925.event: Benito Mussolini delivers a speech which is considered the beginning of this dictatorship.
First televisual image introduced by John Logie Baird.

1926.event: General Georgios Kondylis overthrows General Theodoros Pangalos in Greece.
Emperor Taishō dies; his son, the Emperor Shōwa (Hirohito) becomes Emperor of Japan.

1927.event: The BBC is granted a Royal Charter in the United Kingdom.
Australian Parliament convenes in Canberra for the first time.
The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland officially becomes the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
The Bath School disaster, a series of violent attacks perpetrated by Andrew Kehoe on May 18, 1927, in Bath Township, Michigan, United States, results in 45 deaths.
Charles Lindbergh performs the first nonstop flight from New York City to Paris.
The Jazz Singer, the first "talkie", is released.
Soviet general secretary Joseph Stalin becomes leader of the Soviet Union.

1928.event: Hassan al-Banna founds the Muslim Brotherhood.
King Zog I is crowned in Albania.
Accidental rediscovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming.
The Kellogg-Briand Pact is signed in Paris.
Release date of Steamboat Willie, widely regarded as the first appearance of Mickey Mouse.
The Warlord Era ends in China.

1929.event: Pope Pius XI signs the Lateran Treaty with Italian leader Benito Mussolini, after which the Vatican City is recognised as a sovereign state.
Saint Valentine's Day Massacre, the murder of seven members and associates of Chicago's North Side Gang.
Herbert Hoover is inaugurated as President of the United States.
The first Academy Awards are presented.
Ramsay MacDonald becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Wall Street crash of 1929 and the beginning of the Great Depression.
First people sent to the gulag in the Soviet Union as Stalin assumes effective control.

1930.event: Salt March by Mohandas Gandhi and the official start of civil disobedience in British India.
Haile Selassie becomes Emperor of Abyssinia.
Sinkin' in the Bathtub, the first Looney Tunes short, is released.
The first FIFA World Cup is hosted in Uruguay. The champions are Uruguay.
King Kullen, widely regarded as the first supermarket, opens in Queens, New York City.
Aided by the Great Depression, the Nazi Party increases its share of the vote from 2.6% to 18.3%.
First Round Table Conference between India and Great Britain, which goes until January 1931.
The Vargas Era begins in Brazil.

1931.event: "The Star-Spangled Banner" is adopted as the United States's national anthem.
Floods in China kill up to 2.5 million people.
The Second Spanish Republic is declared.
Japan invades Manchuria, part of the chain of events leading to the start of World War II.
The Chinese Soviet Republic is proclaimed by Mao Zedong.
Statute of Westminster creates the British Commonwealth of Nations.

1932.event: Éamon de Valera becomes President of the Executive Council (prime minister) of the Irish Free State.
The Chaco War between Bolivia and Paraguay begins.
Siamese Revolution establishes a constitutional monarchy.
The neutron is discovered by James Chadwick.
Soviet famine of 1932–33 and Holodomor begin.
The Nazi party becomes the largest single party in the German parliament.
Aldous Huxley publishes Brave New World.

1933.event: Adolf Hitler becomes Chancellor of Germany.
King Kong is released in New York.
Franklin D. Roosevelt is inaugurated as President of the United States, after being elected to the first of his record four terms.
Japan announces it will leave the League of Nations.

Germany announces its withdrawal from the League of Nations and the World Disarmament Conference, after the U.S., the U.K. and France deny its request to increase its defense armaments under the Versailles Treaty.
Prohibition in the United States is abolished.
United States occupation of Nicaragua ends.

1934.event: The Austrian Civil War results in Fascist victory.
The United States grants more autonomy to the Philippines.
Bonnie and Clyde are shot to death in a police ambush.
Adolf Hitler instigates the Night of the Long Knives, which cements his power over both the Nazi Party and Germany.
John Dillinger is gunned down by the FBI outside the Biograph Theater.
The United States occupation of Haiti ends.
With the death of President Hindenburg, Hitler declares himself Führer of Germany.
Mao Zedong begins the Long March.
David Toro overthrows the government of Bolivia in a military coup.

1935.event: Reza Shah of Iran asks the international community to formally adopt the name "Iran" to refer to the country, instead of the name "Persia".
Stanley Baldwin becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Enactment of the Nuremberg racial laws.
The Second Italo-Abyssinian War begins and goes until February 1937. It includes events such as the exile of Haile Selassie and the conquest of Abyssinia by Benito Mussolini.
William Lyon Mackenzie King becomes Prime Minister of Canada.
Manuel L. Quezon becomes President of the Philippines.

1936.event: Edward VIII becomes King of the British Commonwealth and Emperor of India.
Beginning of the Spanish Civil War.
"Benjamin", the last known thylacine, dies in Hobart Zoo.
After a reign shorter than one year, Edward VIII abdicates and hands the throne to his brother, George VI.
Arab Revolt in Palestine against the British begins to oppose Jewish immigration.
George Nissen and Larry Griswold build the first modern trampoline.

1937.event: German zeppelin Hindenburg crashes in Lakehurst, New Jersey, ending the airship era.
Neville Chamberlain becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Japanese invasion of China, and the beginning of World War II in the Far East.
Toyota founded in Japan by Kiichiro Toyoda.
J. R. R. Tolkien publishes The Hobbit.
The Nanjing Massacre begins, ending about a month later in January 1938. It results in 40,000 to 200,000 deaths according to various estimates.
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is the first feature-length animated movie released.
The Irish Republican Army attempts to assassinate King George VI of the United Kingdom.
Volkswagen founded by the German Labour Front.

1938.event: The Great Purge ends after nearly 700,000 executions.
DC Comics hero Superman has its first appearance.

Hungarian newspaper editor László Bíró fills a British patent of the first commercially successful ballpoint pen. This would popularize the instrument, currently the most widely used for writing, after World War II.
Évian Conference ends with all attendee nations save the Dominican Republic refusing to accept more Jewish refugees from the Third Reich.
Munich agreement hands Czechoslovakia to Nazi Germany.
Kristallnacht, a pogrom of over 90 Jews in Germany.
Time Magazine declares Adolf Hitler as Man of the Year.

1939.event: DC's Detective Comics#27 marks the first appearance of Batman in comics.
End of Spanish Civil War; Francisco Franco becomes dictator of Spain.
The Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact between Germany and the Soviet Union.
Release date of MGM's ''The Wizard of Oz.
Ferrari founded in Modena, Italy (as Auto Avio Costruzioni) by Enzo Ferrari.
Nazi invasion of Poland triggers the beginning of World War II in Europe. Soviet invasion of Poland begins 16 days later.
Release date of Gone with the Wind (film).
The Palestinian revolt against the British ends.

1940.event: Chechen insurgency begins in Soviet Union.
The Winter War between Soviet Union and Finland ends with a costly victory for the USSR.
The Katyn massacre of Polish soldiers in USSR and the Soviet occupation of the Baltic states.
Winston Churchill becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
McDonald's founded in San Bernardino, California.
Nazis invade France, the Netherlands, Denmark and Norway.
The Soviet Union annexes the Baltic states.
Battle of Britain, the first entirely aerial military campaign, becomes the first significant defeat for the Axis powers.
Leon Trotsky is assassinated in Mexico.
The Blitz, a German bombing campaign against the United Kingdom, begins.

1941.event: Hitler commences the Nazi invasion of the Soviet Union.
Continuation War between Finland and the Soviet Union begins. Siege of Tobruk in North Africa is the first major defeat for Hitler's land forces.
Operation Reinhard commences the main phase of The Holocaust.
All Star Comics#8 marks the first appearance of Wonder Woman in comics.
Attack on Pearl Harbor, which leads to the USA joining World War II.

1942.event: Battle of Stalingrad and Guadalcanal Campaign begin. Internment of Japanese-American citizens in the US begins.

1943.event: Battle of Stalingrad ends with over two million casualties and the retreat of the German Army.
American Broadcasting Company (ABC) founded in New York City.
The failed Battle of Kursk becomes the last Nazi offensive on the Eastern Front.
Tehran Conference between Franklin Roosevelt, Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin agrees to launch Operation Overlord.
A famine in Bengal kills up to 3 million people.

1944.event: The Siege of Leningrad ends with Soviet victory after over a million deaths.
Chechen insurgency ends with deportation of the entire Chechen population.
First operational electronic computer, Colossus, comes online.
Soviet forces launch Operation Bagration on the Eastern Front, the biggest defeat in German military history.
Adolf Hitler survives the 20 July plot to assassinate him led by Claus von Stauffenberg.
American and Filipino troops begin the Battle of Leyte in the Philippines.

1945.event: Death of Franklin D. Roosevelt; Vice President Harry Truman assumes office as President of the United States.
End of World War II in Europe.
The Holocaust ends after ~12 million deaths, including 6 million Jews.
Clement Attlee becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
The Potsdam Conference divides Europe into Western and Soviet blocs.
Harry S. Truman orders the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
Independence of Indonesia proclaimed begin Indonesian National Revolution.
End of World War II in Asia and beginning of the Surrender of Japan, Proclamation of Independence of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam.
The microwave cooking oven is patented, with the one of the first prototypes placed at a Boston restaurant for testing.
In Brazil, Getúlio Vargas is deposed in a coup.

1946.event: Bhumibol Adulyadej becomes King of Thailand.
The Treaty of Manila declares Philippines independent.
Mustafa Barzani founds the Kurdistan Democratic Party.
First images of the Earth taken from space.

1947.event: Harry Truman establishes the Truman Doctrine of containment of Communism.
Jackie Robinson becomes the first baseball player of color.
Creation of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency.
Independence of India and Pakistan and beginning of First Indo-Pakistani War.
Three Bell Labs engineers give the first public demonstration of the transistor, an electrical component that could control, amplify, and generate current.
Hyundai Group founded by Chung Ju-yung in Seoul, South Korea.

1948.event: Independence of Burma and Ceylon (Sri Lanka) from Britain.
The Marshall Plan, an American initiative for foreign aid of $13 billion to 16 Western European countries, comes into effect.
The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) founded.
The Soviet Sever-2 expedition become the first party to indisputably set foot on the North Pole.
United Nations establishes Israeli Independence and the formation of the official State of Israel.
Division of North and South Korea.
Honda founded in Hamamatsu, Japan by Soichiro Honda and Takeo Fujisawa.
Beginning of apartheid in South Africa.

1949.event: COMECON founded by USSR and the Eastern Bloc.
Former First Lady Aurora Aragon–Quezon is killed in an ambush in the Philippines.
Creation of NATO-backed Federal Republic of Germany (West Germany).
Establishment of the People's Republic of China under CCP Chairman Mao Zedong; The Republic of China relocates to Taiwan.
Creation of the socialist German Democratic Republic (East Germany).
Soviet Union tests the atomic bomb.

1950.event: The Constitution of India comes into effect.
Communist victory in the Landing Operation on Hainan Island (March to May) and Wanshan Archipelago Campaign end the Chinese Civil War (May to August).
North Korean invasion of South Korea begins the Korean War.
The Bodo League Massacre of prisoners during the Korean War.
North Korean forces capture most of Korea, to the Pusan Perimeter.
Bertie the Brain, one of the first computer games, is released.
UN forces reclaim Seoul and invade North Korea.
Alan Turing publishes the Turing test, one of the most influential yet controversial concepts in artificial intelligence research.
Lhamo Dondrub assumes full political powers as the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet.

1951.event: Colombo Plan, a regional organisation of 27 countries designed to strengthen economic and social development of member countries in the Asia-Pacific region, commences.
Release date of Disney's Alice in Wonderland.
The Treaty of San Francisco ends the Occupation of Japan and formally concludes hostilities between Japan and the US.
Release date of the acclaimed science fiction film The Day the Earth Stood Still.
Winston Churchill becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
The Soviet Union has the atomic bomb.

1952.event: Queen Elizabeth II becomes Monarch of the Commonwealth realms.
Bonn–Paris conventions end allied occupation of West Germany.
The first passenger jet flight route opens between London and Johannesburg.
Egyptian Revolution under Gamal Abdel Nasser overthrows King Farouk and ends British occupation.
The United States successfully detonates the first hydrogen bomb, codenamed "Ivy Mike", at Eniwetok Atoll in the Marshall Islands in the central Pacific Ocean, with a yield of 10.4 megatons.
Development of the first effective polio vaccine by Jonas Salk.
The Mau Mau Uprising begins in Kenya.

1953.event: Dwight D. Eisenhower is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Release date of Disney's Peter Pan.
Discovery of the three-dimensional structure of DNA.
An East German Uprising leads to the arrest and execution of Lavrentiy Beria; power struggle begins between Georgy Malenkov and Nikita Khrushchev.
Elvis Presley's musical career is launched.
The first color television is produced.

1954.event: The song Rock Around the Clock, by Bill Haley and His Comets, brings rock and roll to the American mainstream.
The Supreme Court of the United States decides Brown v. Board of Education, ordering an end to racial segregation in public schools.
J. R. R. Tolkien publishes The Fellowship of the Ring, the first volume of The Lord of the Rings.
The Soviet Union generates first electricity by nuclear power.
The Western European Union is established.
Two Miami-based franchisees, David Edgerton and James McLamore, purchase the company "Insta-Burger King" and rename it "Burger King".

1955.event: After winning the power struggle that followed Stalin's death two years earlier, Nikita Khrushchev assumes control of the Soviet Union.
Formation of the Central Treaty Organization.
Death of Charlie Parker, American jazz saxophonist and composer.
Anthony Eden becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
The Salk polio vaccine having passed large-scale trials earlier in the United States, receives full approval by the Food and Drug Administration.
Release date of Disney's Lady and the Tramp.
Death of James Dean, American actor.

1956.event: The Hungarian Uprising crushed by Soviet troops.
Nasser's nationalisation of the Suez Canal triggers the Suez crisis.
Construction of Brasília, the new capital of Brazil to replace Rio de Janeiro, begins.

1957.event: Harold Macmillan becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Philippine President Ramon Magsaysay and 24 others are killed in a plane crash.
Treaty of Rome, which would eventually lead to the European Union.
Independence of the Federation of Malaya.
Launch of Sputnik 1 and the beginning of the Space Age.
Laika becomes the first animal launched into Earth orbit.
First prescription of the combined oral contraceptive pill.
Beginning of the Asian flu in China, leading to a worldwide pandemic that lasts until the following year.

1958.event: Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament (CND) founded. CND's symbol, the peace sign, is first used.
Invention of the optical disc and the cassette tape.

1959.event: Rock and roll musicians Ritchie Valens, Buddy Holly and The Big Bopper die in a plane crash.
Uprising in Tibet against China leads to the exile of the Dalai Lama.
Admission of Alaska, the 49th state, into the United States.
Admission of Hawaii, the 50th state, into the United States.
The U.S.S.R. probe Luna 3 sends back the first ever photos of the far side of the Moon.
Beginning of the Vietnam War, which lasted for almost twenty years until 1975.
Great Chinese Famine begins in China.
By this time, the gulag has been effectively disbanded, after over a million recorded deaths.

1960.event: The assassination of Patrice Lumumba begins the Congo Crisis.
First crewed descent to the deepest point on Earth, the Mariana Trench.
Release date of Disney's One Hundred and One Dalmatians.

The Sharpeville Massacre, in which the police opened fire against a protesting crowd at a police station in the South African township of Sharpeville in Transvaal, resulting in 69 deaths and 180 injuries.
Construction of Brasília, Brazil's new capital, finished.
1960 U-2 incident sparks deterioration in relations between superpowers.
The birth control pill becomes commercially available.
An earthquake in Valdivia, Chile of magnitude 9.4 to 9.6, the highest ever recorded, causes 1,000 to 6,000 deaths.
American boxer Muhammad Ali wins gold.
The first edition of the Summer Paralympic Games is hosted in Rome.
The first episode of The Flintstones airs on ABC.
Inejiro Asanuma, a Japanese socialist politician, is assassinated during a broadcast on TV.
The 1960 United States presidential election marks the first televised debates between presidential candidates.
Khrushchev withdraws Soviet cooperation with China, initiating the Sino-Soviet split.

1961.event: John F. Kennedy is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Yuri Gagarin, flying the Vostok 1 spacecraft as part of the Vostok program, becomes the first human in space.

In an address to Congress, John F. Kennedy declares the United States' objective of "landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to the Earth" by the end of the decade. This would be in fact achieved by the Apollo Project, despite several challenges and much doubt.
UN Secretary General Dag Hammarskjöld dies in a plane crash.
The Great Leap Forward ends in China after the deaths of roughly 20-45 million people.

1962.event: The Algerian War ends with the independence of Algeria.
Marvel's The Incredible Hulk marks the first appearance of the superhero.
Walmart founded in Rogers, Arkansas by Sam Walton.
Marvel's Amazing Fantasy#15 marks the first appearance of Spider-Man in comics.
A coup ends the Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen, establishing the Yemen Arab Republic and starting the North Yemen Civil War.
The Second Vatican Council is opened by Pope John XXIII.
The Cuban Missile Crisis nearly causes nuclear war.
The Sino-Indian War, caused by a border dispute in Aksai Chin, ends with a Chinese victory.

1963.event: Premiere of the Astro Boy anime, the first to be broadcast overseas.
The Beatles' first record, Please Please Me, and the beginnings of the British Invasion.
Bob Dylan releases The Freewheelin' Bob Dylan.
Launch of the first geostationary satellite, Syncom 2.
Martin Luther King Jr. delivers "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.
Alec Douglas-Home becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Assassination of John F. Kennedy. Vice President Lyndon B. Johnson assumes office as President of the United States.
Independence of Kenya and Zanzibar and creation of Malaysia.
Release date of Disney's The Sword in the Stone.

1964.event: Zanzibar Revolution overthrows Arab ruling class; Zanzibar merges with Tanganyika to form Tanzania.
The Beatles' first visit to the United States.
A coup d'état establishes a military dictatorship in Brazil.
Civil Rights Act abolishes segregation in the USA.
The Gulf of Tonkin incident led to the escalation of U.S. military involvement in the Vietnam War.
Release date of Disney's Mary Poppins.
Leonid Brezhnev ousts Khrushchev and assumes power in the Soviet Union.
Harold Wilson becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
NASA launches the Mariner 4 space probe from Cape Kennedy toward Mars to take television pictures of that planet in July 1965.

1965.event: The Voting Rights Act of 1965, inspired by the Selma to Montgomery marches.
Establishment of Rede Globo, now the largest TV network in Brazil and Latin America and the second-largest in the world after ABC.
Israeli spy Eli Cohen is hanged in Damascus.
Congo Crisis ends; Joseph Mobutu becomes dictator of the Congo.
Second Vatican Council is closed by Pope Paul VI.
Ferdinand Marcos becomes President of the Philippines.
Beginning of the anti-Communist purge in Indonesia, which killed up to 500,000 people.

1966.event: The Church of Satan is established in San Francisco by Anton LaVey.
The Beach Boys release Pet Sounds.
The Aberfan disaster, the catastrophic collapse of a colliery spoil tip (pile of waste coal mining material) in Aberfan, Wales results in 144 deaths.
Joseph Weizenbaum, a German computer scientist at MIT, completes ELIZA, the first ever chatbot.

1967.event: First high-speed rail introduced in Tokyo.
Summer of Love, in which as many as 100,000 people, mostly young people sporting hippie fashions of dress and behavior, converged in San Francisco's neighborhood of Haight-Ashbury.
The Six-Day War, a conflict between Israel and Arab states that resulted in Israel occupying the Gaza Strip, the Sinal Peninsula, the West Bank and the Golan Heights.
Attempted secession of the Republic of Biafra from Nigeria triggers the Nigerian Civil War.
Death of John Coltrane, American jazz saxophonist, clarinettist and composer.
Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) founded.
Release date of Disney's The Jungle Book.
The Beatles release their landmark album Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band.
Australian Prime Minister Harold Holt disappears while swimming at Cheviot Beach, Victoria.

1968.event: Protests erupt in the United States, Europe and Latin America.
Prague Spring crushed by the Eastern Bloc military intervention.
The Tet Offensive occurs in South Vietnam.
20th Century Fox releases Planet of the Apes.
The US national debut of Mister Rogers' Neighborhood on National Education Television (NET).
My Lai massacre, a mass murder and rape of unarmed South Vietnamese civilians by U.S. troops in the Vietnam War.
Battle of Karameh in Jordan (part of the War of Attrition between Israel and Arab states).
Assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. during the Poor People's Campaign.
Assassination of Robert F. Kennedy during the Poor People's Campaign.
Another new strain of a flu in Hong Kong spreads again.
The Troubles begin in Northern Ireland.

1969.event: Samsung Electronics founded in Suwon, South Korea.
Richard Nixon is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Concorde 001 flies from the first time, from Toulouse, piloted by André Turcat.
The Stonewall riots in New York City instigate the gay rights movement.
The first human mission to the Moon.
The Manson Family Murders - Under Charles Manson's orders, his followers, the "Manson Family" cult, enter the home of Hollywood actress Sharon Tate and murder her and four others.
The Woodstock festival in Bethel, New York, attracts an audience of more than 400,000.
Muammar Gaddafi overthrows King Idris of Libya in a Coup d'état and establishes the Libyan Arab Republic.
Creation of Advanced Research Projects Agency Network (ARPANET), the earliest incarnation of the Internet.
Sesame Street premieres its debut episode.

1970.event: The Nigerian Civil War ends with the reintegration of the Republic of Biafra with Nigeria after ~3 million deaths.
Ratification of the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.
The Kent State massacre in Ohio leaves four students dead and nine injured.
Edward Heath becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Black September in Jordan begins, lasting until mid-1971.
Death of Egyptian President Gamal Abdel Nasser.
FLQ seizes hostages, causing Prime Minister Pierre Elliot Trudeau of Canada to issue the War Measures Act.
Death of Janis Joplin, American rock, soul and blues singer-songwriter.
Anwar Sadat becomes President of Egypt.
The Bhola Cyclone kills 500,000 people in East Pakistan.
Containerisation adopted globally, massively boosting global trade.

1971.event: Idi Amin seizes power in Uganda.
Bangladesh Liberation War occurred, independence of Bangladesh from Pakistan and precipitates Third Indo-Pakistani War.
Death of Jim Morrison, American lead vocalist of the rock band the Doors.
Death of Louis Armstrong, American musician among the most influential figures in jazz.
Joseph Mobutu renames The Republic of the Congo Zaire.
Intel releases the world's first microprocessor, the Intel 4004.
Nixon shock removes gold back-up for the US Dollar triggering export of inflation from rich to poor nations.

1972.event: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman returns to Bangladesh from imprisonment in Pakistan.
The First Sudanese Civil War ends.

The airplane serving Sabena Flight 571 from Brussels to Lod, Tel Aviv is hijacked by four members of the Black September Organization, a Palestinian terrorist group, resulting in 3 deaths and 3 injuries.
The Munich massacre, perpetrated by the Black September terrorist organization and aimed at the Israeli Olympic team, results in 17 total deaths.
Martial law declared in the Philippines by President Ferdinand Marcos.
Release date of the Magnavox Odyssey, the first commercial home video game console.
The arcade game Pong, the first commercially successful video game, is released.
Release of A Computer Animated Hand, one of the first ever computer animations.

1973.event: The Supreme Court of the United States decides Roe v. Wade.
1 March Pink Floyd's album The Dark Side of the Moon is released in the UK.
Construction of the Sears Tower (later renamed to Willis Tower) completed.
The first space station, Skylab, is launched.
Pioneer 10 sends back the first close-up images of Jupiter.

1974.event: Harold Wilson becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
First close-up images of Mercury by Mariner 10.
Carnation Revolution in Portugal begins transition to democracy.
The Turkish invasion of Cyprus leads to the creation of the Northern Cyprus.
Resignation of Richard Nixon; Vice President Gerald Ford assumes office as President of the United States, the first person not elected as either President or Vice President to take the role.
Emperor Haile Selassie I of Ethiopia is overthrown in a military coup.
Release date of Disney's Robin Hood.
Discovery of "Lucy" (Australopithecus afarensis) in Tanzania's Olduvai Gorge.

1975.event: Altair 8800, the first commercially successful personal computer, is released.
Microsoft founded in Albuquerque, New Mexico by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
The Cambodian Civil War ends with victory for the Khmer Rouge.
The Fall of Saigon ends the Vietnam War.
Juan Carlos I becomes King of Spain.

1976.event: Steve Wozniak invents the Apple I and Steve Jobs then convinces Wozniak to sell the system, giving birth to Apple Computer.
James Callaghan becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Operation Entebbe, a successful counter-terrorist hostage-rescue mission carried out by commandos of the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) at Entebbe Airport in Uganda.
Release of VHS (Video Home System) in Japan.
Church Committee, a U.S. Senate select committee that investigated abuses by the CIA, NSA, FBI and Internal Revenue Service (IRS).
First outbreak of the Ebola virus in Zaire.

1977.event: Jimmy Carter is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Queen Alia of Jordan is killed in helicopter crash.
The Tenerife disaster in the Canary Islands, with 583 fatalities, marks the deadliest accident in aviation history.
Shaba I conflict involves Safari Club.
Star Wars is released and quickly becomes the highest-grossing film of all-time.
Release date of the Atari 2600 video game console in North America.
The last wild case of smallpox is eradicated by the WHO.
Introduction of the first mass-produced personal computers.

1978.event: Louise Brown is the first child successfully born after her mother received in vitro fertilisation treatment.
John Paul I dies, his papacy being one of the shortest in history.
Jim Jones's New religious movement, the Peoples Temple, ends in the organized mass killing and suicide of 920 people in Jonestown.
Deng Xiaoping commences the Chinese economic reform.
The current Constitution of Spain comes into effect, which for some marks the completion of the Spanish transition to democracy.

1979.event: The Vietnamese invasion of Kampuchea ends Cambodia's Khmer Rouge regime.
The Iranian Revolution ends. Shah Reza Pahlavi is overthrown and forced into exile.

The Three Mile Island nuclear accident, a partial meltdown of reactor number 2 of Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station (TMI-2) in Dauphin County, Pennsylvania, near Harrisburg, and subsequent radiation leak.
Margaret Thatcher becomes the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Arrival of Pope John Paul II in Poland, eventually sparking the Solidarity movement.
The Uganda–Tanzania War ends with defeat for Uganda and the exile of Idi Amin.
Beginning of the Salvadorian Civil War.
1.7 million people known to have been murdered in The Killing Fields.
The 1979 oil crisis becomes the second one since 1973.

1980.event: Assassination of Salvadoran Archbishop Oscar Romero.
Independence of Rhodesia, which becomes Zimbabwe.
Queen Beatrix becomes monarch of the Netherlands.
WHO announces the eradication of smallpox.
1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens in Skamania County, state of Washington, leaves approximately 57 deaths and $1 billion of property damage.
The Empire Strikes Back is released.
Release of Pac-Man, the best-selling arcade game.
Solidarity union forms at Poland's Gdańsk Shipyard under Lech Wałęsa, and begins agitation for greater personal freedoms.
Ronald Reagan is elected as the 40th President of the United States, the oldest person to be elected.
Voyager 1 takes the first close-up pictures of Saturn.

1981.event: Ronald Reagan is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Iran releases the 52 U.S. hostages held in Tehran after 444 days.
President Reagan and three others are injured after an assassination attempt.
First orbital flight of the Space Shuttle.
Pope John Paul II assassination attempt.
The AIDS epidemic officially begins in the United States, having originated in Africa; making this to be an ongoing pandemic.
Operation Opera, a surprise airstrike conducted by the Israeli Air Force on an unfinished Iraqi nuclear reactor near Baghdad.
Release date of Steven Spielberg's Raiders of the Lost Ark.
Wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Lady Diana Spencer.

1982.event: The Hama massacre in Syria, a conflict between Syria and the Muslim Brotherhood, results in a decisive Syrian victory and about 10,000 deaths.
First Israeli invasion of Lebanon begins.
Release date of Steven Spielberg's E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial.
Princess Grace of Monaco dies following a car accident.
Sony releases the world's first commercially sold CD Player, the Sony CDP-101.
Death of Leonid Brezhnev; Yuri Andropov becomes General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
Michael Jackson releases his landmark album Thriller, the best-selling album of all time.
The first execution by lethal injection takes place in Texas.

1983.event: The Bombing of U.S. Embassy in Beirut results in 63 deaths.
Nintendo releases the Family Computer (Famicom) video game console in Japan.
Benigno Aquino Jr., Philippine opposition leader, is assassinated in Manila just as he returns from exile.

Korean Air Lines Flight 007, a scheduled flight from New York City to Seoul via Anchorage, Alaska, is shot down by a Soviet Su-15 interceptor, resulting in 269 fatalities and no survivors. This leads to the declassification of GPS development.
Invasion of Grenada by the United States.
The Beirut barracks bombing results in the deaths of 307 people, hastening the removal of international peacekeeping forces in Lebanon.

1984.event: Konstantin Chernenko becomes General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
Assassination of Marvin Gaye, American musician.
Assassination of Indira Gandhi, Indian Prime Minister.
Sino-British Joint Declaration agrees to hand Hong Kong back to China by 1997.
Operation Moses, the covert evacuation of Ethiopian Jews from Sudan during a civil war that caused a famine.
The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is recognized as the cause of HIV/AIDS, and research on zidovudine and other treatments gets underway.
Beginning of the 1983–85 famine in Ethiopia and the 1984-85 UK miners' strike.

1985.event: Michael Jackson and Lionel Richie, USA For Africa released We Are the World.
Mikhail Gorbachev becomes General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
End of military leadership in Brazil.

Beginning of the Iran–Contra affair, a political scandal in the United States that occurred during the second term of the Reagan Administration involving the sale of arms to the Khomeini government of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

73 years after the infamous disaster, the wreck of the Titanic is found off the coast of Newfoundland by a joint French–American expedition led by Jean-Louis Michel of IFREMER and Robert Ballard of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution.
An earthquake in Mexico City, magnitude 8.0, kills from 5,000 to 45,000 people.
Release date of the Macintosh 128K, the first successful mass-market personal computer to feature a graphical user interface, built-in screen, and mouse.
North American release date of the Nintendo Entertainment System, a rebranding of Nintendo's Family Computer.
The Armero tragedy, in which 20,000 people die following the eruption of the Nevado del Ruiz stratovolcano in Tolima, Colombia.
Windows 1.0, the first Microsoft Windows operating system, released.

1986.event: First close-up images of the planet Uranus.
Challenger breaks apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members aboard.
End of dictatorship of Ferdinand Marcos in the Philippines.
Assassination of Olof Palme, Prime Minister of Sweden.
The Chernobyl disaster in Ukraine kills about 100 people.

1987.event: The new Constitution of the Philippines goes into effect.
Release date of the Master System video game console in North America.
A radioactive contamination accident in Goiânia, Brazil, leaves 249 people contaminated, four of which die.
Huawei founded in Shenzen, China by Ren Zhengfei.
Max Headroom signal hijacking in Chicago (WGN-TV and WTTW).
The antidepressant drug fluoxetine (marketed as Prozac) becomes commercially available.
The First Intifada between Israel and Palestine begins.

The passenger ferry MV Doña Paz sinks after colliding with the oil tanker MT Vector 1 in the Tablas Strait in the Philippines, killing an estimated 4,000 people (history's worst peacetime maritime disaster).

1988.event: Beginning of the perestroika ("restructuring"), a political movement for reformation within the Communist Party of the Soviet Union during the 1980s associated with Gorbachev and his glasnost ("openness") policy reform.
Release date of the Mega Drive video game console in Japan.
Pan Am Flight 103 falls over Lockerbie, Scotland, killing 270 people and leaving no survivors.
Myanmar Armed Forces launch a military coup.
Construction of the Channel Tunnel begins.
George H. W. Bush is elected President of the United States.

1989.event: Emperor Shōwa (Hirohito) dies; his son, Akihito (the Emperor Heisei) becomes Emperor of Japan.
George H. W. Bush is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Alfredo Stroessner is overthrown in Paraguay. End of dictatorship.
Fatwa issued against Salman Rushdie.
End of the Soviet war in Afghanistan.
The oil tanker Exxon Valdez spills 10.8 million US gallons of crude oil after striking a reef, causing severe damage to the environment.

Tiananmen Square Massacre, in which troops armed with assault rifles and accompanied by tanks fired at student-led demonstrations held in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, resulting in an undisclosed number of deaths (estimated in hundreds to thousands).
Release date of the Game Boy handheld console in Japan.
Ruhollah Khomeini dies; Ali Khamenei becomes Supreme Leader of Iran.

1989 Polish legislative election although the elections were not entirely democratic, they led to the formation of a government led by Tadeusz Mazowiecki and a peaceful transition to democracy in Poland and elsewhere in Central and Eastern Europe.
1989 Tiananmen Square protests. A crackdown takes place in Beijing on the army's approach to the square, and the final stand-off in the square is covered live on television.

An unknown Chinese protestor, "Tank Man", stands in front of a column of military tanks on Chang'an Avenue in Beijing, temporarily halting them, an incident which achieves iconic status internationally through images taken by Western photographers.
Release date of the Game Boy handheld console in North America.
North American release date of the Sega Genesis, a rebrand of Sega Mega Drive.
Voyager 2 makes its closest approach to Neptune and its largest moon, Triton.
The 6.9 Loma Prieta earthquake shakes the San Francisco Bay Area and the Central Coast, killing 63.
Fall of the Berlin Wall; the Revolutions of 1989 and the collapse of the Soviet Bloc begin in Europe, which leads to the end of the Cold War.
The first direct Presidential election in Brazil since 1960.
Release date of Disney's The Little Mermaid.
A military coup attempt begins in the Philippines against the government of Philippine President Corazon C. Aquino.
The first episode of The Simpsons premieres on Fox.
The United States invasion of Panama begins.
The First Liberian Civil War begins.
Trial and execution of Nicolae and Elena Ceaușescu in Romania.

1990.event: Nelson Mandela is released from Victor Verster Prison outside Cape Town, South Africa after 27 years as a political prisoner.
End of dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet in Chile.
After his election in 1989, Fernando Collor begins his term as the first democratically elected President of Brazil since 1964.
Launch of the Hubble Space Telescope.
North and South Yemen unify to form the Republic of Yemen.
An earthquake measuring kills more than 1,600 in the Philippines.
Release date of the Super Famicom in Japan.
John Major becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Tim Berners-Lee publishes the first web site, which described the World Wide Web project.
Myanmar Armed Forces place Aung San Suu Kyi under house arrest.

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change releases its first assessment report, linking increases in carbon dioxide in the Earth's atmosphere, and a resultant rise in global temperature, to human activities.

1991.event: The Gulf War ends in US withdrawal and a failed uprising.
Beginning of the Sierra Leone Civil War.
Assassination of Rajiv Gandhi, Indian Prime Minister.
Operation Solomon, a covert Israeli military operation to airlift Ethiopian Jews to Israel.
Mount Pinatubo erupts with a Volcanic Explosivity Index of 6 and reduces global temperatures.
The Ten-Day War in Slovenia begins the Yugoslav Wars.
President George H. W. Bush nominates the controversial Clarence Thomas for the Supreme Court of the United States to replace Thurgood Marshall, who had announced his retirement.
Boris Yeltsin becomes the first President of Russia.
The Senate of the Philippines rejects the bilateral treaty with United States which would have extended American use of Subic Bay Naval Base.
Nirvana releases Nevermind, its landmark second album.
Death of Miles Davis, American trumpeter, bandleader, and composer.
North American release date of the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, a rebranding of the Super Famicom.
Linus Torvalds launches the first version of the Linux kernel.
Madrid Conference of 1991.
Tropical Storm Thelma lashes into Eastern Visayas, leaving 8,000 people dead.
Death of Freddie Mercury, British singer, songwriter, and record producer.
Release date of Disney's Beauty and the Beast.
Dissolution of the Soviet Union and independence of 15 former Soviet republics.
Beginning of the Algerian Civil War.
Beginning of the Somali Civil War.
1991 Sino-Soviet Border Agreement.

1992.event: End of the Salvadorian Civil War.
The Maastricht Treaty creates the European Union.
Los Angeles riots over the acquittal of those involved in the beating of Rodney King.
Hurricane Andrew kills 65 and causes $26.5 billion in damages in the Bahamas and the United States.
After the end of its dictatorship, South Korea is admitted to the UN.

El Al Flight 1862, in which a Boeing 747 cargo aircraft of the then state-owned Israeli airline El Al crashes into the Groeneveen and Klein-Kruitberg flats in the Bijlmermeer neighbourhood of Amsterdam, resulting in 43 deaths.
After controversies surrounding him result in an impeachment process, Fernando Collor resigns and Itamar Franco takes office as President of Brazil.
Discovery of the Kuiper belt and the first extrasolar planets.

1993.event: Velvet Divorce between Czech Republic and Slovakia.
Bill Clinton is inaugurated as President of the United States.

The Waco siege, the law enforcement siege of the compound that belonged to the Seventh-day Adventist religious sect Branch Davidians near Waco, Texas, carried out by the U.S. federal government, Texas state law enforcement, and the U.S. military, which results in a gunfight, a fire at the compound and 86 deaths.
Release date of Steven Spielberg's Jurassic Park.
Two UPLB students Eileen Sarmenta and Allan Gomez were abducted and killed by the men of Calauan, Laguna Mayor Antonio Sanchez in the Philippines.
Oslo accords end First Intifada between Israel and Palestine.
The Maastricht Treaty founds the European Union.
Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar is gunned down by police.
The Highland Towers collapse in Selangor, Malaysia, leaving 48 dead.
1993 child sexual abuse accusations against Michael Jackson.

1994.event: Establishment of North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).
Cave of the Patriarchs massacre in the West Bank, a shooting massacre carried out by American-Israeli Baruch Goldstein, which resulted in 30 deaths and 125 injuries.
The assassination of Juvénal Habyarimana and Cyprien Ntaryamira triggers the Rwandan genocide.
Suicide of Kurt Cobain.
End of apartheid in South Africa and election of Nelson Mandela.
Opening of the Channel Tunnel.
First Yemeni Civil War.
Death of Ayrton Senna, Brazilian racing driver.
Release date of Disney's The Lion King.
Release date of Forrest Gump.
Plano Real introduces the new real currency in Brazil.
Colombian footballer Andrés Escobar is shot dead in Medellín.
Amazon founded in Bellevue, Washington by Jeff Bezos.
Death and state funeral of Kim Il-sung. Kim Jong-il becomes Supreme Leader of North Korea.
Release date of Windows NT 3.5.
The car ferry MS Estonia sinks in the Baltic Sea, killing 852 people.
Palau gains independence from the United States.
Release date of the PlayStation in Japan.
The First Chechen War begins.
Construction of the Three Gorges Dam begins in Hubei, China.
Rise of a wave of Palestinian terrorist attacks in Israel.

1995.event: Establishment of the World Trade Organization.
Austria, Finland and Sweden join the European Union.
A 6.9 Great Hanshin earthquake strikes the southern Hyōgo Prefecture of Japan with a maximum Shindo of VII, leaving 5,502–6,434 people dead, and 251,301–310,000 displaced.

The Tokyo subway sarin attack, an act of domestic terrorism perpetrated by members of the doomsday cult movement Aum Shinrikyo (now Aleph), in which they released sarin, an extremely toxic synthetic compound, in five coordinate attacks, resulting in 13 deaths and 6,252 injuries.
Murder of Selena.
Release date of Disney's Pocahontas.
American terrorist Timothy McVeigh bombs the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City.
The Sampoong Department Store collapse, a structural failure in a department store in Seoul, South Korea, kills 502 people and injures other 1,445.
The Srebrenica massacre of over 8,000 Bosniak Muslim men and boys.
The Third Taiwan Strait Crisis begins.
NATO bombing raids in Bosnia end the Bosnian War.
Release date of Windows 95.
Release date of the PlayStation in North America.
Oslo II Accord.
O. J. Simpson is found not guilty of double murder for the deaths of former wife Nicole Simpson and Ronald Goldman in 1994.
Typhoon Angela leaves the Philippines and Vietnam devastated, with 882 deaths and US$315 million in damage.
Assassination of Yitzhak Rabin, Israeli Prime Minister and Defence Minister, by Yigal Amir, an Israeli right-wing extremist.
Premiere of Toy Story, the first computer-animated feature film and the first Pixar Animation Studios film.
The signing of the Dayton Accords put an end to the three-and-a-half-year-long Bosnian War.
The North Korean famine begins.

1996.event: The Ozone Disco Club fire in Quezon City, Philippines, kills 162 people.
The Third Taiwan Strait Crisis ends.
The Port Arthur massacre in Tasmania, Australia leaves 35 people dead, leading to tighter gun regulations in Australia.
Release date of the Nintendo 64 video game console in Japan.
Dolly the sheep becomes the first successful cloned mammal.
A permanent peace agreement is signed at the Malacañan Palace between the Government of the Philippines and the Moro National Liberation Front.
The Taliban government takes control of Afghanistan, creating the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.

1997.event: The Albanian Civil War (Lottery Uprising), sparked by pyramid scheme failures, in which the government was toppled, with new parliamentary elections, and more than 2,000 people killed.

1997 Israeli helicopter disaster, when two Israeli Air Force transport helicopters ferrying Israeli soldiers into Israel's security zone in southern Lebanon collided in mid-air, killing all 73 Israeli military personnel on board.
Murder of Biggie Smalls, American hip-hop artist.
Island of Peace massacre, a mass murder attack that occurred at the Island of Peace on the Israeli-Jordanian border, in which 7 people were killed and 6 injured.
Tony Blair becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Kabila ousts Mobutu; Zaire becomes the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
J. K. Rowling publishes Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone.
Transfer of sovereignty over Hong Kong from the United Kingdom to China.
The Bank of Thailand floats the baht, triggering the Asian financial crisis.
Fashion designer Gianni Versace is murdered by Andrew Cunanan.
The First Liberian Civil War ends.
Diana, Princess of Wales is killed in a car accident in Paris.

1998.event: Osama bin Laden publishes a fatwa against the West.
Riots in Indonesia, including incidents of mass violence, demonstrations, and civil unrest of a racial nature, result in the Fall of Suharto and the independence of East Timor.
Joseph Estrada becomes President of the Philippines.
The Good Friday Agreement brings an end to The Troubles in Northern Ireland.
Google is founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin.
Release date of Nintendo's Game Boy Color handheld console in Japan.
Hurricane Mitch leaves more than 19,325 dead in Central America as a result of catastrophic flooding and mudslides.
Release date of Nintendo's Game Boy Color handheld console in North America.
Sega releases the Dreamcast video game console in Japan.
The impeachment of Bill Clinton begins as a result of the Clinton–Lewinsky scandal.
The North Korean famine has killed an estimated 2.5 million people by this point.

1999.event: Euro introduced to the financial markets. Coins and banknotes enter circulation in participating countries in 2002.
Hugo Chavez becomes President of Venezuela.
A crisis in East Timor, which led to 1,400 deaths, begins.
The Columbine High School massacre in Colorado, United States, causes 15 deaths.
The Second Liberian Civil War begins.
The first episode of SpongeBob SquarePants airs on Nickelodeon.
The end of the Kosovo War ends the Yugoslav Wars.
John F. Kennedy Jr. plane crash.
Russian apartment bombings kill more than 350 people.
Sega releases the Dreamcast video game console in North America.
Vladimir Putin becomes President of Russia.

2000.event: The first day of the 3rd millennium is celebrated worldwide on New Year's Day, though not without dispute.
A rare century leap year date occurs.
The Canonization of Faustina Kowalska occurs in the presence of 200,000 people and the first Divine Mercy Sunday celebrated worldwide.
Release date of the Sony PlayStation 2 in Japan.
Abu Sayyaf gunmen seized 21 people including 10 tourists and 11 resort workers, two of them Filipinos, from the resort island of Sipadan, Malaysia.
End of Israeli occupation of Lebanon.
The ILOVEYOU computer virus affects Windows computers and spreads fast.
The British Army launches Operation Palliser which effectively ends the Sierra Leone Civil War.
India becomes the second country to reach 1 billion people.
Syrian President Hafez al-Assad dies.
2000 inter-Korean summit, the first inter-Korean summit.
Premiere of Disney's Fantasia 2000.
Elián González returns to Cuba with his father, Juan Miguel González, ending a protracted custody battle.
Philippine forces capture the main camp of MILF, Camp Abubakar in Mindanao.
Bashar al-Assad becomes President of Syria.
Air France Flight 4590 crashes into a hotel in Gonesse, France just after takeoff from Paris, killing all 109 aboard and 4 in the hotel.

The Millennium Summit, a meeting among many world leaders at the United Nations headquarters in New York City with the purpose of discussing the role of the United Nations at the turn of the 21st century.
The Second Intifada begins.
Overthrow of Slobodan Milošević, President of Yugoslavia.
al-Qaeda suicide bombs the USS Cole (DDG-67), killing 17 sailors, injuring 39 others, and damaging the ship.
Release date of the Sony PlayStation 2 in North America.
Vicente Fox becomes the first opposition President of Mexico, ending 71 years of single-party rule in the nation.
George W. Bush is elected President of the United States, after a contentious recount in Florida.
First long-term residents (Expedition 1) of the International Space Station, whose first component was launched in 1998.
The Luoyang Christmas fire at a shopping center in China kills 309 people.
Multiple terrorist bombings in Metro Manila occurs on Rizal Day, killing 22 people and injuring more than 120 others.

2001.event: George W. Bush is inaugurated as President of the United States.
An earthquake strikes Gujarat, India, on Republic Day, resulting in more than 20,000 deaths.
Eleven members of the royal family of Nepal, including the king and queen, are killed by Crown Prince Dipendra, who wounds himself and dies three days later.

September 11 attacks: Al-Qaeda terrorists hijack four planes, crashing two into the twin towers of the World Trade Center in New York City, the third plane into the Pentagon in Washington, DC, while the fourth plane is downed on the outskirts of Stonycreek Township, Pennsylvania. 2,996 people, including 2,977 victims and 19 hijackers, die in the attacks.
The United States invades Afghanistan and topples the Taliban regime, resulting in a long-term war.
Steve Jobs introduces the first iPod.
Enron files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy after a series of scandals.
China becomes a member of the World Trade Organization.

2002.event: The Euro enters circulation.
Tom Brady leads the New England Patriots to win their first Super Bowl; during a nearly two decade span, they would appear in nine, winning six.
Golden Jubilee of Elizabeth II.
Riots and mass killings in the Indian state of Gujarat leave 1,044 dead.
East Timor gains independence.
The International Criminal Court is established.
The African Union is founded.
The First Ivorian Civil War begins.
Mozilla Firefox is released.
The 2002 Bali bombings killed 202 people and injured 209 more.
Chechen rebels seize a theater in Moscow. Amid this siege, around 200 people died.
Switzerland joins the United Nations as the 190th member.
Steve Fossett becomes the first person to fly solo nonstop around the world.
Israel starts Operation Defensive Shield in the West Bank in response to a wave of Palestinian suicide attacks.
Construction of the Israeli West Bank barrier begins.
SpaceX is founded by Elon Musk.
America demands Iraq allow unfettered access to weapons inspectors.
The Guantanamo Bay detention camp is established.
The Algerian Civil War ends.
Hu Jintao is elected as General Secretary of the Communist Party of China.

2003.event: Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrates upon reentry, killing all 7 astronauts on board.
The United States invades Iraq and ousts Saddam Hussein, triggering worldwide protests and an 8 year war.
The first six-party talks, involving South and North Korea, the United States, China, Japan and Russia.
The Rose Revolution occurs in Georgia.
The Human Genome Project is completed.
The Second Congo War ends with more than 5 million dead.
The Second Liberian Civil War ends.
The last Volkswagen Beetle is made in Mexico, after 65 years in production.
Final flight of the SST (Supersonic Transport) Concorde.

2004.event: Facebook is formed by Mark Zuckerberg, Andrew McCollum, Eduardo Saverin, Dustin Moskovitz, and Chris Hughes.
Madrid train bombings killed 193 people and injured around 2,000, Europe's deadliest attack since Pan Am Flight 103.

On September 1st (first school day in Russia), a group of chechen terrorists held students, parents and teachers hostage in Beslan school, in North Ossetia–Alania. During three days under attack, 334 people died.
Boston Red Sox wins the World Series for the first time since 1918, ending the Curse of the Bambino.
The Second Battle of Fallujah occurs. It is the deadliest American battle since Vietnam, killing 95 troops.
President of the Palestinian National Authority Yasser Arafat dies.
Union of South American Nations formed.
Boxing Day Tsunami occurs in Indian Ocean, leading to the deaths of 230,000.
NATO and the European Union incorporates most of the former Eastern Bloc.
Spirit and Opportunity land on Mars.
First surface images of Saturn's moon Titan.

2005.event: YouTube is founded by Jawed Karim, Chad Hurley and Steve Chen.
Cedar Revolution in Lebanon triggered by the assassination of Rafic Hariri.
The Kyoto Protocol comes into effect.
Pope John Paul II dies, Benedict XVI becomes Pope.
Reddit is founded by Steve Huffman, Aaron Swartz and Alexis Ohanian.
Floods in Maharashtra, India kill over 1000 people.
Hurricane Katrina kills 1,836 people in the Gulf of Mexico.
80,000 are killed in an earthquake in Kashmir.
Angela Merkel becomes Germany's first female Chancellor.
The Provisional Irish Republican Army ends its military campaign in Northern Ireland.

2006.event: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf becomes President of Liberia, and thus Africa's first elected female head of state.
A coup d'état in Thailand overthrows the government of Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra.
Google acquires YouTube for US$1.65 billion.
Comprehensive Peace Accord ends the Nepalese Civil War.
The International Astronomical Union creates the first formal definition of a planet, and excludes Pluto from the list.

2007.event: Gordon Brown becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Anti-government protests in Myanmar suppressed by ruling junta.
Spike in food prices and subprime crisis help trigger global recession.

2008.event: Stock markets plunge around the world, signaling the start of the Great Recession.
Dmitry Medvedev becomes President of Russia.
The 1st Nepalese Constituent Assembly declares Nepal a republic, ending its monarchy.
Barack Obama is elected to become the first black President of the United States.
Kosovo declares independence, though it is not recognised by the United Nations.
Iraqi forces crack down on Muqtada al Sadr's Mahdi forces in Basra and Sadr City.
The Large Hadron Collider is completed as the world's largest and most powerful particle collider.
Tesla Roadster launched, the first mass production lithium-ion battery electric car.

2009.event: Barack Obama is inaugurated as President of the United States, the first African-American to hold the office.
Typhoon Ketsana kills 789 people in the Philippines.
The Gaza War ends while Gaza blockade continues.
The Sri Lankan Civil War ends.
Boko Haram rebellion begins in Nigeria.
2009 swine flu pandemic began in North America.

2010.event: A 7.0 magnitude earthquake in Haiti kills 230,000.
2010 Nigerien coup d'état.
2010 Moscow Metro bombings.
The President of Poland, Lech Kaczyński, is among 96 killed when their airplane crashes in Smolensk.
The largest oil spill in US history occurs in the Gulf of Mexico.
After the 2010 United Kingdom general election, David Cameron becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Gaza flotilla raid.
The FIFA World Cup is held in Africa for the first time.
2010 Colombia–Venezuela diplomatic crisis.
North Korea shells the island of Yeonpyeong.
Avatar overtakes Titanic as the highest-grossing film.
A military crackdown occurs in Thailand.
The threat of Greece defaulting on its debts triggers the European sovereign debt crisis and Republic of Ireland's financial crisis.
Burmese political prisoner Aung San Suu Kyi is released from house arrest.
Arab Spring starts.
Kyrgyz Revolution of 2010.
The Burj Khalifa in Dubai becomes the tallest structure in the world, standing at 829.8 m (2,722 ft).
Dilma Rousseff is elected as the first female president of Brazil.
The iPad is introduced.
Instagram is launched.

2011.event: World population reaches 7 billion.
Christchurch earthquake kills 185 and injures 2,000.
A 9.0 earthquake in Japan triggers a tsunami and the meltdown of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant.
Wedding of Prince William and Catherine Middleton.
Osama bin Laden is shot dead by United States Navy SEALs in Pakistan.
Independence of South Sudan.
2011 Norway attacks.
Riots flare across England.
Muammar Gaddafi is captured and killed during the Battle of Sirte.
Snapchat launched.
revolutions in Tunisia, Egypt and Libya follow, as well as uprisings in Yemen and Bahrain, and protests in several other Arab countries.
Syrian civil war begins.
Second Ivorian Civil War.
Occupy movement inspires worldwide protests.
News International phone hacking scandal.
The Danyang–Kunshan Grand Bridge, the world's longest, opens in China.
Second Ivorian Civil War ends with the arrest of former president Laurent Gbagbo.
Iraq War ends.
Bombings occur in Russia and Somalia.
Floods in Pakistan, Thailand and the Philippines kill roughly 2,500 people.
Space Shuttle program is officially ended.
Amazon Rainforest and River, Hạ Long Bay, Jeju Island, Iguazú Falls, Puerto Princesa Underground River, Komodo Island and Table Mountain were named as the world's New7Wonders of Nature.
NASA launches spacecraft to visit Jupiter and Mars.

2012.event: Killing of Trayvon Martin: The 17-year-old African-American high school student was killed in Sanford, Florida.
Vladimir Putin is elected president of Russia for the third time.
Skydiver Felix Baumgartner becomes the first person to break the sound barrier without a vehicle.
Hurricane Sandy causes $70 billion in damage and kills 233 people.
Barack Obama wins second term as President of the United States, defeating former Massachusetts Governor Mitt Romney.
Xi Jinping is elected as General Secretary of the Communist Party of China.
UN Climate Change Conference agrees to extend the Kyoto Protocol until 2020.
Conflict begins in the Central African Republic.
Israel launches Operation Pillar of Defense against the Palestinian-governed Gaza Strip.
The US rover, Curiosity, takes a selfie on Mars and finds evidence of an ancient streambed of water on the Red Planet.

2013.event: An undiscovered meteor strikes the Chelyabinsk oblast in Russia, with an airburst injuring thousands and damaging many buildings.
Pope Benedict XVI resigns, the first Pope to do since 1415, and Pope Francis is elected, becoming the first Pope from Latin America.
Death and state funeral of Hugo Chavez.
The Rana Plaza collapses in Bangladesh.
President of Egypt Mohamed Morsi is deposed by the military in a coup d'état.
A chemical attack in Ghouta, Syria is blamed on President Bashar al-Assad.
A 7.2 magnitude earthquake in Bohol, kills 222.
Typhoon Haiyan kills nearly 6,150 people in Vietnam and the Philippines.
The Euromaidan protest begins in Ukraine.
Death and state funeral of Nelson Mandela.
The French military intervenes in the Northern Mali conflict.
Terrorist attacks occur in Boston and Nairobi.
Edward Snowden releases classified documents concerning mass surveillance by the NSA.
Croatia becomes a member of the European Union.
Uruguay becomes the first country to fully legalize cannabis.

2014.event: The worst Ebola epidemic in recorded history occurs in West Africa, infecting nearly 30,000 people and resulting in the deaths of 11,000+.
Euromaidan protest in Ukraine sparks a revolution and the overthrow of Viktor Yanukovych, leading to Russia's annexation of Crimea and the War in Donbas.
Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappears from radar while en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur on March 8. There were 239 people on board
The MV Sewol sinks, killing 304 of 476 passengers, 250 of which were students at Danwon High School
A coup d'état in Thailand overthrows the caretaker government.
King Juan Carlos I of Spain abdicates; his son becomes King Felipe VI.
The shooting of African-American teenager Michael Brown by police leads to violent unrest in Ferguson, Missouri.
The Rosetta spacecraft's Philae probe becomes the first to successfully land on a comet.
Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan kill over 130 students in Pakistan.
Indonesia AirAsia Flight 8501 crashes into the Java Sea, while Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 is shot down over Ukraine and Air Algérie Flight 5017 is downed in Mali.
Israel launches an assault on the Gaza Strip in response to tit-for-tat murder-kidnappings, leading to the deaths of 71 Israelis and 2,100 Palestinians.
ISIS begins its offensive in northern Iraq, leading to intervention in Iraq and Syria by a US-led coalition.
Narendra Modi is elected as the Prime Minister of India.

2015.event: Boko Haram perpetrates a massacre of over 2,000 people in Baga, Nigeria, and allies itself with ISIL.
Al-Shabaab perpetrates a mass shooting in Kenya, killing 148.
The death of African-American teenager Freddie Gray by police leads to violent unrest in Baltimore, Maryland.
195 nations agree to lower carbon emissions.
A series of terrorist attacks occur in Paris.
A series of earthquakes in the Himalayas kills over 10,000 people.
The heads of China and Taiwan meet for the first time, while the United States and Cuba resume diplomatic relations.
Liquid water is found on Mars.
First close-up images of Ceres and Pluto.
China announces the end of One-child policy after 35 years.
The Supreme Court of the United States determines that same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry.
Homo naledi, a species of early human, is discovered in Africa.

2016.event: El Chapo is recaptured following his escape from a high-security prison in Mexico.
Detection of gravitational waves by LIGO confirmed.
Barack Obama becomes the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge in 1928.
Panama Papers, a leak of legal documents, reveals information of 214,888 offshore companies.
The Gotthard Base Tunnel, the world's longest and deepest railway tunnel, is completed.
A shooter kills 49 people at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida.
The people of the United Kingdom vote to leave the European Union; David Cameron resigns as a result, and Theresa May succeeds him as the Prime Minister.
Chicago Cubs wins the World Series for the first time since 1908, ending the Curse of the Billy Goat.
The Paris Agreement, signed by 195 nations to fight global warming, formally goes into effect.
Donald Trump wins the 2016 presidential election, in an upset against Hillary Clinton, the first female to be nominated for a major party.
The United Nations lifts sanctions from Iran in recognition of the dismantling of its nuclear program.
Pope Francis and Patriarch Kirill sign the Ecumenical Declaration, the first meeting between Catholic and Orthodox heads since their split in 1054.
ISIL claims responsibility for a series of bombings in Brussels, a massacre at Istanbul's Atatürk Airport and car ramming attacks in Nice.
Augmented-reality game, Pokémon Go, is released, breaking records in revenue, and becoming the best-selling mobile game.
The Colombian government signs a peace deal with FARC to end the Colombian conflict, despite narrowly losing a referendum.
The government of Turkey begins a series of purges in reaction to a failed coup d'état attempt.

2017.event: Donald Trump is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Millions of people participated in the Women's March, as a response to the inauguration of Donald Trump.
Kim Jong-nam, the half-brother of Kim Jong-Un, is assassinated in Kuala Lumpur.
A terrorist bombing attack at an Ariana Grande concert in Manchester, England kills 22 people and injures over 140.

The city of Charlottesville is the site of a far-right rally protesting the removal of Confederate statues throughout the US. During the event, a white supremacist rams his car into a crowd of counter-protesters, injuring 19 and killing one.
A solar eclipse passes throughout the contiguous United States for the first time since 1918.
Two earthquakes strike Mexico on September 8 and September 19, killing over 400 people.
60 people are killed in a mass shooting at a music festival in Las Vegas.
A bombing in Mogadishu, Somalia on October 14, kills 587 people and injures 316. It is one of the deadliest terrorist attacks in modern history.
26 people are killed in a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas.
Tensions between North Korea and the UN escalate as the country tests a hydrogen bomb and conducts a series of ballistic missile tests. The UN responds with a wave of export sanctions.

Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) launch simultaneous attacks in Tehran, destroy the Great Mosque of al-Nuri in Mosul Iraq, and kill 311 in Egypt, but are declared defeated in Iraq by the end of the year.
A military operation targeting Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar is declared ethnic cleansing by the UNHCR.

This year's Atlantic Hurricane season features Hurricane Harvey, which kills 107 and becomes the costliest hurricane in US history, as well as Hurricane Irma, killing 134, and Hurricane Maria, killing 3,059.
